Name: Suspending parking rules when fuel rationing is in effect.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to suspending parking rules when fuel rationing is in effect

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
This Introduction was Filed (End of Session)

Summary: This bill would suspend alternate side parking rules during periods of fuel rationing.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

	Section 1. Subchapter 2 of chapter 1 of title 19 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 19-163.3 to read as follows: 
      � 19-163.3 Suspension of parking rules during fuel rationing. Alternate side of the street parking rules shall be suspended during periods when fuel rationing is required in the city by a local emergency order promulgated under section twenty-four of the executive law, an executive order promulgated under section twenty-nine-a of the executive law or is otherwise lawfully required, provided that the department may reinstate alternate side of the street parking rules after consulting with the department of sanitation.
      � 2.  This local law takes effect immediately.
